description: This definition represents the notifications generated by the Infinera network element that are categorized as alarmed conditions

Summary.eval: ($v10==2) ? 'Service affecting $v9 alarm on node $v3 : $v15' : '$v9 alarm on node $v3 : $v15'

objects.test: $SNMPTRAPCMD INFINERA-NOTIFICATION-MIB::infnAlarmNotification INFINERA-NOTIFICATION-MIB::alarmNotificationId i 9999 INFINERA-NOTIFICATION-MIB::alarmNodeId s EXAMPLE INFINERA-NOTIFICATION-MIB::alarmNodeName s EXAMPLE INFINERA-NOTIFICATION-MIB::alarmObjectType i 1 INFINERA-NOTIFICATION-MIB::alarmObjectAid s EXAMPLE INFINERA-NOTIFICATION-MIB::alarmSourceOid o 1.3.6.1.4.1.8072.2.1.1 INFINERA-NOTIFICATION-MIB::alarmProbableCause i 1 INFINERA-NOTIFICATION-MIB::alarmSeverity i 1 INFINERA-NOTIFICATION-MIB::alarmCategory i 1 INFINERA-NOTIFICATION-MIB::alarmServiceAffecting i 1 INFINERA-NOTIFICATION-MIB::alarmOccurrenceTime s EXAMPLE INFINERA-NOTIFICATION-MIB::alarmLocation i 1 INFINERA-NOTIFICATION-MIB::alarmDirection i 1 INFINERA-NOTIFICATION-MIB::alarmProbableCauseDescription s EXAMPLE INFINERA-NOTIFICATION-MIB::alarmAdditionalText s EXAMPLE INFINERA-NOTIFICATION-MIB::alarmCorrelationId i 9999

description: This object represents the Notification ID generated by NE for
each alarmed notification.
variables.name: INFINERA-NOTIFICATION-MIB::alarmNotificationId

description: This object representsthe Node ID of the network element.
variables.name: INFINERA-NOTIFICATION-MIB::alarmNodeId

description: This object represents the name of the network element. This is similar to the TID representation in TL1.
variables.name: INFINERA-NOTIFICATION-MIB::alarmNodeName

description: This object represents the managed object type that is reporting the alarm.
variables.name: INFINERA-NOTIFICATION-MIB::alarmObjectType

description: This object represents the Object Name of the facility in the Access Identifier format.
variables.name: INFINERA-NOTIFICATION-MIB::alarmObjectAid

description: This object represents the object ID instance of the managed object on which the alarm is reported.
It is used as a handle to query the details about the object which is in the alarmed state.
variables.name: INFINERA-NOTIFICATION-MIB::alarmSourceOid

description: This object represents the probable cause of the alarm.
variables.name: INFINERA-NOTIFICATION-MIB::alarmProbableCause

description: This object represents the severity of the alarm.
variables.name: INFINERA-NOTIFICATION-MIB::alarmSeverity

description: This object indicates whether the alarm is service affecting or not.
variables.name: INFINERA-NOTIFICATION-MIB::alarmServiceAffecting

description: This object represents the alarm occurrence date and time expressed in format YYYY-MM-DD<space>hh:mm:ss
variables.name: INFINERA-NOTIFICATION-MIB::alarmOccurrenceTime

description: This object represents the location of the alarmed entity.
variables.name: INFINERA-NOTIFICATION-MIB::alarmLocation

description: This object represents the direction of the alarmed entity.
variables.name: INFINERA-NOTIFICATION-MIB::alarmDirection

description: This object represents the alarm probable cause description.
variables.name: INFINERA-NOTIFICATION-MIB::alarmProbableCauseDescription

description: This object represents the additional text describing the alarm in more concrete details.
variables.name: INFINERA-NOTIFICATION-MIB::alarmAdditionalText

description: This object represents the alarm correlation ID generated by
the Network Element.
variables.name: INFINERA-NOTIFICATION-MIB::alarmCorrelationId

description: This definition represents the notifications generated by the Infinera network element that are categorized as Threshold Crossing Alerts (TCAs).

Summary.eval: ($v10==2) ? 'Service affecting threshold crossing alarm on $v4 $v5 : $v18' : 'Threshold crossing alarm on $v4 $v5 : $v18'

objects.test: $SNMPTRAPCMD INFINERA-NOTIFICATION-MIB::infnTcaNotification INFINERA-NOTIFICATION-MIB::tcaNotificationId i 9999 INFINERA-NOTIFICATION-MIB::tcaNodeId s EXAMPLE INFINERA-NOTIFICATION-MIB::tcaNodeName s EXAMPLE INFINERA-NOTIFICATION-MIB::tcaObjectType i 1 INFINERA-NOTIFICATION-MIB::tcaObjectAid s EXAMPLE INFINERA-NOTIFICATION-MIB::tcaSourceOid o 1.3.6.1.4.1.8072.2.1.1 INFINERA-NOTIFICATION-MIB::tcaProbableCause i 1 INFINERA-NOTIFICATION-MIB::tcaSeverity i 1 INFINERA-NOTIFICATION-MIB::tcaCategory i 1 INFINERA-NOTIFICATION-MIB::tcaServiceAffecting i 1 INFINERA-NOTIFICATION-MIB::tcaOccurrenceTime s EXAMPLE INFINERA-NOTIFICATION-MIB::tcaLocation i 1 INFINERA-NOTIFICATION-MIB::tcaDirection i 1 INFINERA-NOTIFICATION-MIB::tcaMonitoredValue s EXAMPLE INFINERA-NOTIFICATION-MIB::tcaThresholdValue s EXAMPLE INFINERA-NOTIFICATION-MIB::tcaTimePeriod s EXAMPLE INFINERA-NOTIFICATION-MIB::tcaProbableCauseDescription s EXAMPLE INFINERA-NOTIFICATION-MIB::tcaAdditionalText s EXAMPLE

description: This object represents the Notification ID generated by NE for
each TCA notification.
variables.name: INFINERA-NOTIFICATION-MIB::tcaNotificationId

description: This object represents the Node ID of the network element.
variables.name: INFINERA-NOTIFICATION-MIB::tcaNodeId

description: This object represents the name of the network element. This is similar to the TID representation in TL1.
variables.name: INFINERA-NOTIFICATION-MIB::tcaNodeName

description: This object represents the managed object type that is reporting the alarm.
variables.name: INFINERA-NOTIFICATION-MIB::tcaObjectType

description: This object represents the Object Name of the facility in the Access Identifier format.
variables.name: INFINERA-NOTIFICATION-MIB::tcaObjectAid

description: This object represents the object ID instance of the managed object on which the TCA is reported.
It is used as a handle to query the details about the object which is in the TCA state.
variables.name: INFINERA-NOTIFICATION-MIB::tcaSourceOid

description: This object represents the probable cause of the alarm.
variables.name: INFINERA-NOTIFICATION-MIB::tcaProbableCause

description: This object represents the severity of the TCA.
variables.name: INFINERA-NOTIFICATION-MIB::tcaSeverity

description: This object indicates whether the alarm is service affecting or not.
variables.name: INFINERA-NOTIFICATION-MIB::tcaServiceAffecting

description: This object represents the tca occurrence date and time expressed in format YYYY-MM-DD<space>hh:mm:ss.
variables.name: INFINERA-NOTIFICATION-MIB::tcaOccurrenceTime

description: This object represents the location of the alarmed entity.
variables.name: INFINERA-NOTIFICATION-MIB::tcaLocation

description: This object represents the direction of the alarmed entity.
variables.name: INFINERA-NOTIFICATION-MIB::tcaDirection

description: This object represents the current threshold value.
variables.name: INFINERA-NOTIFICATION-MIB::tcaMonitoredValue

description: This object represents the configured threshold value.
variables.name: INFINERA-NOTIFICATION-MIB::tcaThresholdValue

description: This object represents the time period (e.g. 15-MIN or 24-HR) for which the TCA has been raised.
variables.name: INFINERA-NOTIFICATION-MIB::tcaTimePeriod

description: This object represents the TCA probable cause description
variables.name: INFINERA-NOTIFICATION-MIB::tcaProbableCauseDescription

description: This object represents the additional text describing the TCA
variables.name: INFINERA-NOTIFICATION-MIB::tcaAdditionalText

description: This definition represents the notifications generated by the Infinera network element that are categorized as events.
objects.test: $SNMPTRAPCMD INFINERA-NOTIFICATION-MIB::infnAdminEventNotification INFINERA-NOTIFICATION-MIB::infnAdminNotificationId i 9999 INFINERA-NOTIFICATION-MIB::infnAdminNodeId s EXAMPLE INFINERA-NOTIFICATION-MIB::infnAdminNodeName s EXAMPLE INFINERA-NOTIFICATION-MIB::infnAdminObjectType i 1 INFINERA-NOTIFICATION-MIB::infnAdminObjectAid s EXAMPLE INFINERA-NOTIFICATION-MIB::infnAdminSourceOid o 1.3.6.1.4.1.8072.2.1.1 INFINERA-NOTIFICATION-MIB::infnAdminEventTime s EXAMPLE INFINERA-NOTIFICATION-MIB::infnAdminCause s EXAMPLE

description: This object represents the Notification ID generated by NE for
each admin event notification.
variables.name: INFINERA-NOTIFICATION-MIB::infnAdminNotificationId

description: This object represents the node Id of the network element.
variables.name: INFINERA-NOTIFICATION-MIB::infnAdminNodeId

description: This object represents the name of the network element.
variables.name: INFINERA-NOTIFICATION-MIB::infnAdminNodeName

description: This object represents the managed object type that is reporting the admin event.
variables.name: INFINERA-NOTIFICATION-MIB::infnAdminObjectType

description: This object represents the Object Name of the facility in the Access Identifier format.
variables.name: INFINERA-NOTIFICATION-MIB::infnAdminObjectAid

description: This object represents the object ID instance of the managed object on which the admin event is reported.
variables.name: INFINERA-NOTIFICATION-MIB::infnAdminSourceOid

description: This object represents the event occurrence date and time expressed in format YYYY-MM-DD<space>hh:mm:ss.
variables.name: INFINERA-NOTIFICATION-MIB::infnAdminEventTime

description: This object represents the admin event description
variables.name: INFINERA-NOTIFICATION-MIB::infnAdminCause

event.Summary: User $v7 performed audit operation $v10 on $v8. Status: $v11

objects.test: $SNMPTRAPCMD INFINERA-NOTIFICATION-MIB::infnAuditEventNotification INFINERA-NOTIFICATION-MIB::infnAuditNotificationId i 9999 INFINERA-NOTIFICATION-MIB::infnAuditNodeId s EXAMPLE INFINERA-NOTIFICATION-MIB::infnAuditNodeName s EXAMPLE INFINERA-NOTIFICATION-MIB::infnAuditObjectType i 1 INFINERA-NOTIFICATION-MIB::infnAuditObjectAid s EXAMPLE INFINERA-NOTIFICATION-MIB::infnAuditSourceOid o 1.3.6.1.4.1.8072.2.1.1 INFINERA-NOTIFICATION-MIB::infnAuditUserId s EXAMPLE INFINERA-NOTIFICATION-MIB::infnAuditHostInfo s EXAMPLE INFINERA-NOTIFICATION-MIB::infnAuditTime s EXAMPLE INFINERA-NOTIFICATION-MIB::infnAuditOperationName s EXAMPLE INFINERA-NOTIFICATION-MIB::infnAuditOperationStatus s EXAMPLE INFINERA-NOTIFICATION-MIB::infnAuditParamsList s EXAMPLE

description: This object represents the Notification ID generated by NE for
each audit notification.
variables.name: INFINERA-NOTIFICATION-MIB::infnAuditNotificationId

description: This object represents the Node ID of the network element.
variables.name: INFINERA-NOTIFICATION-MIB::infnAuditNodeId

description: This object represents the name of the network element.
variables.name: INFINERA-NOTIFICATION-MIB::infnAuditNodeName

description: This object represents the managed object type that is reporting the audit event.
variables.name: INFINERA-NOTIFICATION-MIB::infnAuditObjectType

description: This object represents the Object Name of the facility in the Access Identifier format.
variables.name: INFINERA-NOTIFICATION-MIB::infnAuditObjectAid

description: This object represents the object ID instance of the managed object on which the audit is reported.
variables.name: INFINERA-NOTIFICATION-MIB::infnAuditSourceOid

description: This is the user name who has issued this operation
variables.name: INFINERA-NOTIFICATION-MIB::infnAuditUserId

description: This is hostname or IP address from where operation was issued.
variables.name: INFINERA-NOTIFICATION-MIB::infnAuditHostInfo

description: This object represents the event occurrence date and time expressed in format YYYY-MM-DD<space>hh:mm:ss.
variables.name: INFINERA-NOTIFICATION-MIB::infnAuditTime

description: The name of operation which was given by user.
variables.name: INFINERA-NOTIFICATION-MIB::infnAuditOperationName

description: The status of the operation for this Audit Event. Could be success or failure etc.
variables.name: INFINERA-NOTIFICATION-MIB::infnAuditOperationStatus

description: This attribute contains DisplayString data in comma separated format. The data represents the attributes and their values that got affected by the operation which resulted in this Audit event.
variables.name: INFINERA-NOTIFICATION-MIB::infnAuditParamsList

description: This definition represents the notifications generated by the Infinera network element that are categorized as security events.
objects.test: $SNMPTRAPCMD INFINERA-NOTIFICATION-MIB::infnSecurityEventNotification INFINERA-NOTIFICATION-MIB::infnSecurityNotificationId i 9999 INFINERA-NOTIFICATION-MIB::infnSecurityNodeId s EXAMPLE INFINERA-NOTIFICATION-MIB::infnSecurityNodeName s EXAMPLE INFINERA-NOTIFICATION-MIB::infnSecurityObjectType i 1 INFINERA-NOTIFICATION-MIB::infnSecurityObjectAid s EXAMPLE INFINERA-NOTIFICATION-MIB::infnSecuritySourceOid o 1.3.6.1.4.1.8072.2.1.1 INFINERA-NOTIFICATION-MIB::infnSecurityHostInfo s EXAMPLE INFINERA-NOTIFICATION-MIB::infnSecurityEventTime s EXAMPLE INFINERA-NOTIFICATION-MIB::infnSecurityMessage s EXAMPLE

description: This object represents the Notification ID generated by NE for
each audit notification.
variables.name: INFINERA-NOTIFICATION-MIB::infnSecurityNotificationId

description: This object represents the Node ID of the network element from which the event is generated.
variables.name: INFINERA-NOTIFICATION-MIB::infnSecurityNodeId

description: This object represents the name of the network element.
variables.name: INFINERA-NOTIFICATION-MIB::infnSecurityNodeName

description: This object represents the managed object type that is reporting the security event.
variables.name: INFINERA-NOTIFICATION-MIB::infnSecurityObjectType

description: This object represents the user name.
variables.name: INFINERA-NOTIFICATION-MIB::infnSecurityObjectAid

description: This object represents the object ID instance of the user on which security event is reported.
variables.name: INFINERA-NOTIFICATION-MIB::infnSecuritySourceOid

description: This is hostname or IP address from where command was issued.
variables.name: INFINERA-NOTIFICATION-MIB::infnSecurityHostInfo

description: This object represents the event occurrence date and time expressed in format YYYY-MM-DD<space>hh:mm:ss.
variables.name: INFINERA-NOTIFICATION-MIB::infnSecurityEventTime

description: This object represents the security event description
variables.name: INFINERA-NOTIFICATION-MIB::infnSecurityMessage
